10:46 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:55 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <vmassol> guys, we don't have any API to delete a document without loading it?  
11:01 <lucaa> has quit  
11:04 <vmassol> anyone?  
11:05 <vmassol> I cannot believe we don't have such an api…  
11:06 <tmortagne> vmassol: we don't  
11:06 <tmortagne> it's a very old issue  
11:06 <tmortagne> same issue with rename  
11:07 <vmassol> wow… so we're very inefficient for deleting stuff  
11:07 <tmortagne> yes  
11:07 <tmortagne> problem is also that even if we have such an API we store a bug XML of the whole document an history in the recycle bin  
11:08 <tmortagne> s/bug/big/  
11:08 <tmortagne> so the model is pretty inefficient too  
11:08 <vmassol> yes  
11:08 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
11:09 <tmortagne> we could do that recycle bin in a streamed way using WikiStream bu MySQL does not supported stream anyway  
11:10 <huhongbo> has quit  
11:10 <vmassol> I guess we could also not move the doc but instead just have a status flag in the doc table (for state = deleted)  
11:10 <vmassol> this means all requests would need to filter the state  
11:11 <vmassol> (but that could be done at a low level in our apis)  
11:11 <vmassol> ofc this wouldn't support the feature of having a different storage for deleted docs…

15:06 <vmassol> cjd: ping  
15:07 <vmassol> we have a field for sources on e.x.o ;)  
15:07 <vmassol> so you could remove your last change and instead use that source field  
15:07 <vmassol> you'll get a nice "Source" button  
15:07 <vmassol> when viewing your extenson  
15:08 <cjd> thanks  
15:11 <vmassol> :)  
15:14 <vmassol> cjd: nice last user on https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/compatibleone-poc  
15:14 <vmassol> also by CompatableOne I think you meant CompatibleOne ;)  
15:14 <vmassol> (on https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/compatibleone-poc)

17:57 <sdumitriu> sdumi  
17:58 <cjd> /msg chanserv auth s3cr1t  
17:58 <cjd> nvm  
17:58 <sdumitriu> Hm, is that your password?  
17:58 <cjd> haha no  
17:58 <cjd> it was re 17:57 <@sdumitriu> sdumi  
17:58 <sdumitriu> Yeah, I was trying to Ctrl+F  
17:58 <cjd> ahh  
17:59 <sdumitriu> To see if someone mentioned me  
17:59 <cjd> idk what my passwd is, it's long and /dev/urandomish  
17:59 <cjd> ah hah  
17:59 <sdumitriu> My home internet is broken  
18:00 <cjd> Where I'm staying the network is iffey, it's freewifi and my wifi card has a nasty habit of getting into a bad state where the only fix is to reboot  
18:01 <j-simard> has left #xwiki  
18:03 <sdumitriu> I'm using a secondary ISP, one that's using a major company's wires but a lot cheaper and without a long term contract, but the main ISP is trying hard to convince users to switch  
18:03 <sdumitriu> So they do their "best" to make the you want to switch  
18:04 <cjd> oh right  
18:04 <cjd> the old "give them the crappy loop" trick  
18:04 <cjd> rogers and teksavvy?  
18:04 <sdumitriu> Yep  
18:04 <cjd> I heard rogers has a free 3g plan  
18:05 <cjd> as long as you only use UDP on port 68, you get free unlimited internet  
18:05 <vmassol> cjd: come on guys you don't need wifi to get internet access! Just use high frequency sounds ;)  
18:06 <cjd> heh  
18:06 <cjd> I bet that's really slow  
18:06 <vmassol> ok then I have a better plan: use light  
18:06 <cjd> Free Space Optics  
18:06 <vmassol> there are some new bulbs lights that do this apparently  
18:06 <sburjan> has quit  
18:07 <vmassol> http://www.independent.co.uk/news/science/lifi-revolution-internet-connections-using-light-bulbs-are-250-times-faster-than-broadband-8909320.html  
18:07 <cjd> they use like 15 watt lasers which are able to cut through most atomospheric conditions  
18:07 <cjd> but extreme fog will kill your connection  
18:09 <cjd> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free-space\_optical\_communication <-- this stuff is currently deployed in some networks  
18:09 <cjd> very fast but beware of weather conditions

18:48 <vmassol> hmm when I look at the last commit I did in git for commons, the author is "Vincent Massol". But on github it says vmassol. So I guess GitHub looks for all users having a name matching the git author in order to find the userid…  
18:50 <msmeria> has quit  
18:50 <vmassol> or maybe it checks the email actually (that would be a better check)  
18:51 <vmassol> yep that's it  
18:51 <vmassol> https://help.github.com/articles/why-are-my-commits-linked-to-the-wrong-user  
18:51 <vmassol> it uses the email
